candidates.definition: Buildings designed for business activities, commerce, or providing services to customers.

positive_examples: The new shopping mall opened with over 200 stores and restaurants.
Our company moved to a modern office building downtown last month.
The airport terminal was crowded with travelers waiting for flights.
She works at a tech startup located in a converted warehouse building.
The restaurant building featured floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the harbor.
The retail complex houses several banks, shops, and a food court.
negative_examples: They built a beautiful new house with a three-car garage.
The old church needed renovations to its historic bell tower.
Students gathered in the university library to study for exams.
The hospital's emergency room was busy throughout the night.
The prison facility housed over 2,000 inmates in multiple wings.
The factory manufactured automobiles around the clock.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: ResidentialBuildings, InstitutionalBuildings, IndustrialBuildings, ReligiousBuildings

candidates.definition: Buildings designed for manufacturing, processing, or producing goods and beverages on a commercial scale.

positive_examples: The textile factory employed hundreds of workers on the production floor.
They toured the chocolate manufacturing plant during the field trip.
The brewery expanded its facilities to increase beer production capacity.
Wine barrels aged in the temperature-controlled winery building.
The automotive assembly plant operates three shifts daily.
Smoke stacks rose from the steel mill complex.
negative_examples: The grocery store warehouse stored products for distribution.
Corporate headquarters housed the company's executive offices.
The shopping mall featured dozens of retail stores.
Students attended classes in the university lecture hall.
Patients waited in the hospital emergency room.
The apartment building had twenty residential units.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: ResidentialBuilding, CommercialBuilding, OfficeBuilding, WarehouseBuilding

candidates.definition: Buildings associated with agricultural properties for farming activities, storage, or rural residential use.

positive_examples: The old red barn stored hay and housed the dairy cows during winter.
They converted the farmhouse into a charming bed and breakfast.
The farmer parked his tractor in the garage attached to his rural home.
We toured the historic barn where they once processed maple syrup.
The farmhouse kitchen had a large window overlooking the pasture.
She stored her farming equipment in the garage next to the house.
negative_examples: The office building downtown has twenty floors of corporate suites.
Students gathered in the university library to study for exams.
The shopping mall features over a hundred retail stores.
Patients waited in the hospital emergency room lobby.
The factory produces automotive parts for major manufacturers.
Worshippers filled the church pews for Sunday morning service.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: CommercialBuilding, PublicBuilding, IndustrialBuilding, ReligiousBuilding

candidates.definition: Buildings designed to serve public functions and community needs, operated by or for government and civic institutions.

positive_examples: The new city hall will house the mayor's office and council chambers.
Students gathered at the main library to study for their exams.
The police station was built in the downtown district for better community access.
Our elementary school is getting renovated over the summer break.
The courthouse steps were filled with protesters demanding justice.
Voters lined up outside the municipal building to cast their ballots.
negative_examples: The hospital emergency room was crowded with patients.
We stayed at a beautiful hotel overlooking the harbor.
The shopping mall has over 200 stores and restaurants.
The cathedral's Gothic architecture drew thousands of tourists.
Their office building houses several tech companies.
The apartment complex will have 300 residential units.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: CommercialBuilding, ResidentialBuilding, IndustrialBuilding, ReligiousBuilding

candidates.definition: Buildings or structures designed primarily for hosting entertainment, performances, or recreational events for audiences.

positive_examples: The concert hall was packed for the symphony performance tonight.
We watched the game from the team's dugout during batting practice.
The theater's auditorium features excellent acoustics for live performances.
The baseball stadium's dugout was filled with excited players.
She performed on stage in the main auditorium of the performing arts center.
The movie theater's screening room was upgraded with new sound systems.
negative_examples: The office building downtown houses several corporate headquarters.
Students gathered in the school's gymnasium for physical education class.
The hospital's emergency room was busy with patients all night.
Worshippers filled the church sanctuary for Sunday morning service.
The shopping mall's food court was crowded during lunch hour.
The library's reading room provided a quiet space for studying.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: ReligiousBuilding, EducationalBuilding, CommercialBuilding, ResidentialBuilding, IndustrialBuilding

candidates.definition: Buildings specifically designed to facilitate or control vehicle movement and traffic flow.

positive_examples: The airport parking garage had seven levels for travelers.
She stopped at the toll booth to pay the highway fee.
The multi-story parking structure was full during the concert.
Traffic backed up at the toll plaza on the interstate.
The automated parking garage used robots to park cars.
He pulled up to the toll collector's booth at the bridge entrance.
negative_examples: The bus terminal had waiting areas for passengers.
The train station featured a large departure hall.
The subway entrance led down to the platform.
The airport terminal was crowded with travelers.
The taxi dispatcher worked from a small office building.
The mechanic worked in the auto repair shop.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: CommercialBuilding, ResidentialBuilding, InstitutionalBuilding, IndustrialBuilding
